extDescription.message: Detects and highlights different Dark Patterns on websites.

errorInvalidConfig.message: The internal pattern configuration of the extension is invalid. The Dark.Dec will not start.
errorInvalidConfig.description: The error message in case of an invalid internal pattern configuration.

buttonOnState.description: The message when the switch is turned on in the popup.

buttonOffState.description: The message when the switch is turned off in the popup.

buttonReloadPageForChange.description: Text for the button to reload the page after a changed activation state.

buttonRedoPatternCheck.description: Text for the button to repeat the pattern highlighting on the page.

headingShowPattern.description: Heading in the popup for the buttons to show individual pattern elements.

headingFoundPatterns.description: Heading in the popup for the list of found patterns.

headingSupportedPatterns.description: Heading in the popup for the list of supported patterns.

textMoreInformation.description: Text in the footer preceding the link to the dapde.de website.

infoExtensionStarted.description: Message in the console when the Dark.Dec was started on a page.

infoExtensionDisabled.message: Dark.Dec is disabled for this tab.
infoExtensionDisabled.description: Message in the console when the Dark.Dec is disabled in a tab.

infoNumberPatternsFound.description: Message in the console about how many patterns were detected.

patternCountdown_infoUrl.description: URL to the explanation of the countdown pattern on the dapde.de website.

patternCountdown_info.message: Countdown patterns induce (truthfully or falsely) the impression that a product or service is only available for a certain period of time. This is illustrated through a running clock or a lapsing bar. You can watch as the desired good slips away.
patternCountdown_info.description: Brief explanation of the countdown Pattern.

patternTrickWording_infoUrl.description: URL to the explanation of the countdown pattern

patternTrickWording_info.message: The user is misled into taking an action, due to the presentation of confusing or misleading language.
patternTrickWording_info.description: Brief explanation of the countdown Pattern.

patternHardToCancel_name.description: They want to cancel they find it very hard.

patternHardToCancel_infoUrl.description: URL to the explanation of the countdown pattern

patternHardToCancel_info.message: This typically involves hiding the cancellation option, requiring users to call customer services to cancel, and making the cancellation process overly complex and time-consuming. This can cause users to give up trying to cancel, and continue paying for the service for a longer period.
patternHardToCancel_info.description: Brief explanation of the countdown Pattern.

patternScarcity_infoUrl.description: URL to the explanation of the scarcity pattern on the dapde.de website.

patternScarcity_info.message: Fake scarcity works by creating an artificial sense of limited availability around a product or service, pushing users to act quickly out of fear of missing out. This is achieved by displaying misleading messages about low stock levels or high demand.
patternScarcity_info.description: Brief explanation of the scarcity Pattern.

patternSocialProof_name.description: Name of the social proof pattern.

patternSocialProof_infoUrl.description: URL to the explanation of the social proof pattern

patternSocialProof_info.message: Social Proof is another Dark Pattern of this category. Positive product reviews or activity reports from other users are displayed directly. Often, these reviews or reports are simply made up. But authentic reviews or reports also influence the purchase decision through smart selection and placement.
patternSocialProof_info.description: Brief explanation of the social proof Pattern.

patternForcedContinuity_name.description: Name of the forced continuity pattern.

patternForcedContinuity_infoUrl.description: URL to the explanation of the forced continuity pattern

patternForcedContinuity_info.message: The Forced Continuity pattern automatically renews free or low-cost trial subscriptions - but for a fee or at a higher price. The design trick is that the order form visually suggests that there is no charge and conceals the (automatic) follow-up costs.
patternForcedContinuity_info.description: Brief explanation of the forced continuity Pattern.

showPatternState.description: Display the number of the current pattern in the popup for the 'Show patterns' function.
